benchmark_details.name: MIRIAD (Medical Instruction and Retrieval Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: MIRIAD is a large-scale, curated corpus of 5,821,948 medical instruction-response pairs, each rephrased from and grounded in a passage from peer-reviewed medical literature using a semi-automated pipeline combining LLM generation, filtering, grounding, and human annotation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: MIRIAD aims to provide a comprehensive knowledge base for down-stream medical AI applications, enabling improved retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) performance in clinical tasks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models trained with and without MIRIAD on various medical question-answering tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Improved metrics indicate enhanced performance when using MIRIAD compared to unstructured sources.
methodology.baseline_results: Existing medical QA datasets like PubMedQA consist of fewer than 300,000 questions.
methodology.validation: The dataset undergoes multi-tier quality control including automated filtering and human expert annotation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: ODC-By v1.0, allows reuse and modification with proper attribution.
